definition:
Let $F$ be a field of characteristic $p>0$. Then for any $a, b \in F$,
$$\begin{aligned}
(a + b)^p &=& a^p + b^p,
\\ (ab)^p &=& a^p b^p.\end{aligned}$$

Thus the map $$\begin{matrix}\phi: F &\to& F 
\\ a &\mapsto& a^p
\end{matrix}$$ is a field homomorphism, called the *Frobenius
homomorphism*, or simply the *Frobenius map* on $F$. If it is surjective
then it is an automorphism, and is called the *Frobenius automorphism*.

Note: This morphism is sometimes also called the “small Frobenius” to
distinguish it from the map $a \mapsto a^q$, with $q=p^n$. This map is
then also referred to as the “big Frobenius” or the “power Frobenius
map”.
